intro: Erigeron triplinervis, commonly known as the three-veined fleabane, is a flowering plant in the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its daisy-like flowers with white ray florets and yellow disk florets. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky areas. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, with a distinct three-veined structure. Erigeron triplinervis is native to North America and is often found in the central and southern United States.
